title.narrative: CHILD POVERTY AND PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Policy and Advocacy)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Disaggregated data and analytical evidence on monetary and multidimensional child poverty, and information on public social sector spending are available to inform advocacy and programming.

description.narrative: Strategic partnerships on public finance provided unprecedented opportunities to engage in the budget cycle and strengthen dialogue to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of public resources so that all children, especially the most vulnerable, get a fair chance in life. UNICEF developed sectoral budget briefs with national counterparts, engaged in regional dissemination of the citizen's budget and facilitated, for the first time, dialogue on the Open Budget Survey. In addition, the Burundi Adolescent Investment Case was launched, providing evidence on the high returns of investments in adolescent girls and boys that constitute 23 per cent of the population. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: 1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty
3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children
Child poverty (multidimensional) is routinely measured and reported by the government
